### USER:
Proof this 10Q report and make it better
# Purple Aerospace Manufacturing Corporation 10Q Report

## Purple Aerospace, Confidential

### Part I - Financial Information

#### Item 1. Financial Statements

The financial statements of Purple Aerospace Manufacturing Corporation for the quarter ended March 31, 2021, prepared in accordance with U.S. GAAP, are attached herewith.

#### Item 2. Management's Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations

Purple Aerospace has maintained a steady growth trajectory, with a significant increase in revenue from our diverse product portfolio, including engine parts, avionics systems, and satellite components. Our strategic alliances with major airlines, defense contractors, and space exploration companies have also contributed to our financial growth.

Our investment in research and development has resulted in groundbreaking products, including a new type of satellite propulsion system and a revolutionary avionics system. These innovations have not only increased our market share but also positioned us as a leader in aerospace technology.

Our financial stability has been further strengthened by the effective financial strategies implemented by our CFO, Ms. Laura Simmons. Her expertise in corporate finance has played a crucial role in our financial growth and stability.

### Part II - Other Information

#### Item 1. Legal Proceedings

There are no significant legal proceedings to which Purple Aerospace is a party.

#### Item 2. Unregistered Sales of Equity Securities and Use of Proceeds

No unregistered sales of equity securities occurred during the quarter ended March 31, 2021.

#### Item 3. Defaults Upon Senior Securities

There were no defaults upon senior securities during the quarter ended March 31, 2021.

#### Item 4. Mine Safety Disclosures

Not applicable.

#### Item 5. Other Information

Purple Aerospace is currently working on several exciting projects, including the development of a network of spy satellites in collaboration with the United States government. This project is being carried out with utmost confidentiality and has the potential to revolutionize the field of satellite surveillance.

### Part III - Financial Statements and Supplementary Data

Attached herewith.

### Part IV - Controls and Procedures

Under the supervision of our CEO, Dr. Amelia Hartman, and CFO, Ms. Laura Simmons, we have evaluated the effectiveness of our disclosure controls and procedures as of the end of the period covered by this report. Based on this evaluation, we believe that our disclosure controls and procedures are effective in ensuring that information required to be disclosed in our reports is recorded, processed, summarized, and reported within the time periods specified by the Securities and Exchange Commission's rules and forms.

### Signatures

Dr. Amelia Hartman, Chief Executive Officer

Ms. Laura Simmons, Chief Financial Officer

Date: April 30, 2021

This report contains forward-looking statements that involve risks and uncertainties. Our actual results may differ materially from the results discussed in the forward-looking statements. Factors that might cause such a difference include, but are not limited to, those discussed in "Item 1A - Risk Factors" in our Annual Report on Form 10-K for the year ended December 31, 2020.

# Purple Aerospace Manufacturing Corporation 10Q Report

## Purple Aerospace, Confidential

### Part I - Financial Information

#### Item 1. Financial Statements

Enclosed are the financial statements of Purple Aerospace Manufacturing Corporation for the quarter ending March 31, 2021. These have been prepared in strict accordance with U.S. GAAP.

#### Item 2. Management's Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations

Purple Aerospace has consistently demonstrated growth, with a notable increase in revenue from our diverse product portfolio, which includes engine parts, avionics systems, and satellite components. Our strategic partnerships with major airlines, defense contractors, and space exploration companies have significantly contributed to our financial growth.

Our commitment to research and development has led to the creation of groundbreaking products, such as a novel satellite propulsion system and a revolutionary avionics system. These innovations have not only expanded our market share but also established us as a frontrunner in aerospace technology.

Our financial stability has been further fortified by the effective financial strategies implemented by our CFO, Ms. Laura Simmons. Her proficiency in corporate finance has been instrumental in our financial growth and stability.

### Part II - Other Information

#### Item 1. Legal Proceedings

Purple Aerospace is not currently involved in any significant legal proceedings.

#### Item 2. Unregistered Sales of Equity Securities and Use of Proceeds

There were no unregistered sales of equity securities during the quarter ending March 31, 2021.

#### Item 3. Defaults Upon Senior Securities

No defaults on senior securities occurred during the quarter ending March 31, 2021.

#### Item 4. Mine Safety Disclosures

Not applicable.

#### Item 5. Other Information

Purple Aerospace is currently engaged in several exciting projects, including the development of a network of spy satellites in partnership with the United States government. This project is being conducted with the highest level of confidentiality and has the potential to revolutionize the field of satellite surveillance.

### Part III - Financial Statements and Supplementary Data

Enclosed herewith.

### Part IV - Controls and Procedures

Under the guidance of our CEO, Dr. Amelia Hartman, and CFO, Ms. Laura Simmons, we have evaluated the effectiveness of our disclosure controls and procedures as of the end of the period covered by this report. Based on this evaluation, we are confident that our disclosure controls and procedures are effective in ensuring that information required to be disclosed in our reports is recorded, processed, summarized, and reported within the time frames specified by the Securities and Exchange Commission's rules and forms.

### Signatures

Dr. Amelia Hartman, Chief Executive Officer

Ms. Laura Simmons, Chief Financial Officer

Date: April 30, 2021

This report contains forward-looking statements that involve risks and uncertainties. Our actual results may differ significantly from the results discussed in the forward-looking statements. Factors that might cause such a difference include, but are not limited to, those discussed in "Item 1A - Risk Factors" in our Annual Report on Form 10-K for the year ended December 31, 2020.</s>
